title: Cup And Saucer, ca. 1935
markings: Marks: Printed underglazed in green on underside of (a) and (b): "[architect's compass] beneath m/c/p and above d/p."
creditline: Museum purchase from Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Fund
description: Creamy-grey porcelain body. (a) cup is cylindrical in shape, with curved lower section that tapers to circular foot. Handle is placed high on body, formed as reversed "U." Platinum band painted around lip. (b) Saucer plain. Circular, with upward curve at rim and central circular depression.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cup And Saucer, ca. 1935.
ca. 1935. porcelain. Museum purchase from Decorative Arts Association Acquisition Fund. 1992-10-12-a,b.
